question.text: The gas inside a spherical bubble expands uniformly and slowly so that its radius increases from <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>R</mi></math> to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. The atmospheric pressure is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and surface tension is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>s</mi></math>. The work done by the gas in the process is

solution.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mrow></munderover><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mspace linebreak="newline"/><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfrac><mrow><mn>28</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>24</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>
